Body:
I was taught (according to Role and Reference Grammar) that epistemic modality applies at clause level while deontic modality applies at core level. So in theory a sentence which has both would have the epistemic modality "further away" from the verb than the deontic. For example, I [probably [have to wash the car]].

But then what is happening in a sentence like I should probably wash the car? It seems more natural for me to say it that way than I probably should wash the car.
Title: Epistemic modality inside deontic scope?
